Message.Title: Boeing To loose another All Boeing customer , how is that cheap outsourcing working for you Now CEO!
Message.Msg: TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan Airlines Co may buy about 20 A350 jets from Airbus for around 400 billion yen ($4.23 billion), the Nikkei daily reported on Sunday, a move that would reduce its reliance on Boeing . The Japanese carrier is considering using A350-1000 jets on flights to Europe and the United States to replace its Boeing 777 jets, and is set to make a final decision on the purchase by around June, the newspaper said, without citing sources. Japan Airlines and Airbus could not be immediately reached for comment. The deal for the 350-seater planes would be the first with the European aircraft maker and includes a simulation facility for pilot training. Japan Airlines is set to retire its lone McDonnell Douglas MD-90 jet after a final flight on March 30, leaving it with a fleet of more than 100 aircraft, all manufactured by Boeing, the report said. The carrier's seven Boeing 787 Dreamliner jets have been grounded since mid-January after problems with its lithium-ion battery. IN financial related update, Boeing stock price has gained only 16% gain in three years , Boeing is one of the Dow Jones Stocks , the Dow Jones average is up 33% in 3 years, Airbus stock price has gained 162% in the last 3 years but it gets worse fore Boeing investors. The outsourcd 787 is 3 years late 33 billion over budget and the control and understaning of why the failure of the 787 has taken place is in the hands of the cheap contractors.They engineered and produced the parts. The Boeing investor has to pay like an insurer for any failurre on the contractors' performance. However the Boeing CEO is not worried, he gave himself a 20% performance Bonus on the stockholders investment !BA stock price gain YTDis up 12% while Airbus stock price gain YTD 35% . , Japan which was as a country for decades a 100% Boeing customer and a parts supplier is going with Airbus planes due to the failure of Chicago Management team So how's that outsourcing working for you now !

Message.Msg: Without the benefit or a drooling media Obama is perceived for what he is -- a big phoney "Despite Barack Obama's promises to salvage America's reputation abroad from all the damage supposedly done by the Bush administration, a survey shows support for the United States in several Middle East countries has dipped below its level from George W. Bush's final year in office. According to the Pew Research Center's Global Attitudes Project, "confidence in Obama" in Muslim countries such as Egypt, Jordan, Lebanon, and Pakistan fell from 33% to 24% during his first term alone. Approval of his policies fell even further--from a high of 34% to the current low of 15%."

Message.Title: What do Cessna, lithium batteries and the 787 Boeing plane share ? except for stock price ?
Message.Msg: The Cessna Aircraft Company of Wichita, Kansas, USA, has been the most productive aerospace company, Cessna total production of 192,991 aircraft through the end of 2009. Boeing stockholders have gained 12% YTD Ouch ! , Airbus stockholders have made 35%, YTD For 3 years Boeing stock holders have made only 16%, woof and Ouch ! Airbus stockholders have made 162% Next month Airbus will start to buy back 15% of the Airbus stocks to compete with Boeing stock price manipulation. The Dow Jones Average on a ETF investment is up is up 33% for 3 years . Cessna is owned by Textron symbol TXT their investors are up by 24% YTD and for 3 years have made 44%. So for Boeing investors that is a big woof woof ,woof and ouch ! Now unlike Boeing's top brass making a battery and smoke fire box that will double the original weight of the lithium batteries , Cessna simply replaced their same condition lithium ion firestarter with nicad batteries and were fine , So a real Big woof,woof, woof for the Boeing Board room power point rangers It flies in the Board room but it stays on the ground in Everett. The FAA says it has reviewed Cessna Citation Service Bulletin SB525C-24-05, dated September 29, 2011. The service information describes procedures for replacing lithium-ion main aircraft batteries, Cessna P/N 9914788-1, with Ni-Cad or lead acid batteries. The agency is issuing this AD following evaluation of all the relevant information and determined the unsafe condition(fire and smoke ) described previously is likely to exist or develop in other products of the same type design. The AD requires accomplishing the actions specified in the service information described previously. Within the next 10 hours time-in-service after the effective date of this AD or within the next 7 days after the effective date of this AD, whichever occurs first, replace the lithium-ion main aircraft battery, P/N 9914788-1, following Cessna Citation Service Bulletin SB525C-24-05, dated September 29,

Message.Title: Paralyzed Iraq veteran plans to starve himself to death blaming Bush and Cheney
Message.Msg: The Iraq veteran who can no longer go on: Husband, 33, who was paralysed by sniper bullet four days into deployment plans to starve himself to death almost a decade on Army veteran Tomas Young enrolled in the Army two days after 9/11 Deployed to Iraq in 2004 and paralyzed by sniper's bullet four days later Mr Young plans to refuse nourishment as he is in constant pain Veteran has written his last letter to George W. Bush and #$%$ Cheney shaming them for killing thousands in the war An Iraq war veteran who has lived with extensive injuries since being paralyzed during the conflict has admitted that he no longer has the will to live. For nearly a decade, veteran Tomas Young, has been living in chronic pain after being paralyzed by a sniper's bullet four days into his first assignment in the Middle East. Now the married 33-year-old, who can no longer eat solid foods, plans to refuse nourishment as he is tired of the exhaustive struggle that his life has become.

Topic.Title: According to the Bible - the RW evangelical is to speed Global Warming

Message.Msg: Neo-evangelicals are right in pointing out that the Bible is not meant to be a science text. They also are correct in recognizing the limitation of human language. However, if their views were accepted, the results would be devastating. Jesus’ words and actions seem to contradict many of their claims. He said, “If I told you earthly things and you do not believe, how shall you believe if I tell you heavenly things?” (John 3:12) Jesus expected His accuracy in factually testable matters to be proof that He was telling the truth about spiritual matters that cannot be tested. Again, Jesus said to the crowd, “Which is easier, to say to the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven’; or to say, ‘Arise, and take up your pallet and walk’? But in order that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,’ He said to the paralytic, ‘I say to you, rise, take up your pallet and go home’” (Mark 2:9-11). Jesus proved that what He said about faith and the unverifiable realm was true by giving a very verifiable and physical healing. He made a point to say that what God says about this world demonstrates His truthfulness about the other world.

Topic.Title: Bipartisan Dems Help Kill Carbon Tax

Message.Msg: No wealth redistribution if 100% of money is returned to the people. Inefficient energy hogs like Al Gore would get hit because of using limos and private jets and having multiple properties that waste energy when no one is there living in them. The rich will have every opportunity to lower their energy use to the same level as you. As it stands right now you are actually subsidizing people like al Gore for their energy use. I will provide to you a real world example of why you would benefit. Let's say you live in a 2,000 sq.ft. house with a wife and one child. Prices for airline tickets, gas, etc would rise because of the tax. If you pay $4,000.00/yr. for electricity you can use your $9,000.00 rebate check to buy solar panels to bring your electricity cost down to $1,000.00/year. If you don't fly you save there too. If you do fly your rebate check offsets the added costs. Same with gas if gas is raised $1.00/gal. and you use 2,000 gallons per year you don't incur any increase in costs. If you drive a gas guzzler that gets 14 MPG and switch to a car that gets 25MPG you then pay less for gas net. This is a free market solution that empowers consumers and would help make the USA energy independent much sooner as we would make smarter energy decisions. The sooner we are free of Arab, African, Venezuelan oil the safer we are from future shortages like we had under Carter. What's wrong with that?

Topic.Title: Bipartisan Dems Help Kill Carbon Tax

Message.Msg: Let me just add that oil and gas are not going to be available forever and that while we have discovered new reserves they are ultimately a finite resource. I am all over the map politically but what is wrong with wanting to have my own energy sources rather than depending on the government or oil companies? If storage technology improves I can live off grid and be totally free from dependence on others for energy and avoid future power outages that are coming with bad policy decisions like the UK has made. Don't you want to be empowered to be free and independent?

Message.Title: The Linguistics of the Second Amendment...and why Liberal authoritarians get it so wrong !
Message.Msg: When I used to teach composition, it was common for students to say, “I know what I wanted to say, but I just didn’t know how to say it.” I always told them, “What you know is reflected in your words. If it’s not in the words, you don’t know it.” That was true thirty-five years ago and it’s true today. And there is a corollary to that maxim: people assume that what you say is true. It may not be, but the opening assumption is that your words reflect the truth. Otherwise, there would be little point in talking. ads not by this site These maxims – that words reflect what you know and that they reflect the truth – can be used as a weapon. For example, people who oppose private gun ownership often say that the Second Amendment protects hunting. Obama says that he doesn’t want to take anyone’s hunting rifle and has his picture taken firing a long-barreled shotgun. Anti-gun senators always introduce their remarks with fond memories of their hunting rifles. Their purpose is to convince us they are in favor of the Second Amendment, as they have re-defined it. But the Second Amendment is not about hunting. It’s about protecting citizens from an overreaching government. If that problem didn’t exist, there would have been no Second Amendment for the Framers didn’t need the Constitution to tell them they could go hunting. They needed the Constitution because they feared another King George. When the conversation is confined to what guns are appropriate for, hunting, or even when it is expanded to include self-defense (as in Heller), it becomes presumptively true (words reflect what is known and they are presumptively true) that the Second Amendment is only about self-defense and hunting. And once the issue is framed this way, the only guns citizens will be allowed to own will be for those purposes. But our Second Amendment rights, just like those of the Framers, concern our right to resist a tyrannical government, and for that, we need military weapons

Topic.Title: Short BA with both hands at 75.16.

Topic.Title: The Linguistics of the Second Amendment...and why Liberal authoritarians get it so wrong !

Message.Msg: continued....Nonetheless, our opponents have been able to cast the discussion of the Second Amendment as being about hunting. They have been able to do this because even though fear of tyranny has been part of our heritage since the beginning, public attention has never been directed to the purposes of the Second Amendment, and it has never been taught in the schools. None of us grew up aware of the possibility that our own government could one day be the enemy. That part of our heritage became apparent only with the election of President Obama, when people saw, for the first time, that one man might actually destroy the government and the society in which we live. Then, for the first time, the idea of an overreaching government hell-bent on wrecking our traditions, our way of life, our belief systems, our laws, and even the make-up of the population became a reality. So when we discuss the Second Amendment and the right of citizens to own weapons, we must do it in the context of the primary reason we need weapons at all: protection against tyranny from within. If we conduct the discussion on our opponents’ terms, if we allow them to define the need for weapons as self-defense and hunting, we will have lost the battle.

Topic.Title: According to the Bible - the RW evangelical is to speed Global Warming

Message.Msg: Climate change isn't anything new. Those of us that study history and the Paleoclimate record know this. “God Almighty has a quarrel lately with all Mankind,” lamented the Welsh historian James Howell in 1647, “for within these 12 years there have been the strangest Revolutions and horridest things happened, not only in Europe but all the world over.” The world, he thought, was “off the hinges”. He was not alone. As civil strife raged in the British Isles, rebellion tore holes in the empires of the Ming and the Ottomans, and central Europe bled in the Thirty Years’ War, other commentators sank into despair. Every day, recorded the Oxford scholar Robert ­Burton in 1638, brought news of “war, plagues, fires, inundations, thefts, murders, massacres, meteors, comets, spectrums, prodigies, apparitions; of towns taken, cities besieged in France, ­Germany, Turky [sic], Persia, Poland etc”. Four years later, a Spanish tract suggested a terrifying but increasingly popular explanation: “This seems to be one of the epochs in which every nation is turned upside down, leading some great minds to suspect that we are now approaching the end of the world.”
